Params: {3: 'Your last memory is the grotesque claws of a Hetero-Creature.'}
{3: 'After the explosion of sudden pain, your consciousness is violently torn from your body.'}
{3: 'Your field of vision suddenly lurches skyward. This unbearably long "dream" grinds on, unbroken by your "unconscious" state.'}
{3: "The sky above you silently cracks open. A white bird soars through, carrying a storm in its wake, and within those chaotic clouds, Liv's memories glimmer and shine."}
{3: 'From this peculiar vantage point, you begin to read Liv\'s "memories."'}
{3: 'When Liv switched to this new frame, it demanded a lengthy adaptation period of syncing her consciousness with the new data.'}
{3: 'During that time, the two of you were virtually inseparable. You undertook a series of simple missions, side-by-side, and found a rare, almost peaceful rhythm in the quiet between them.'}
{3: 'When there was only one week left until the adaptation period was over...'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Holding the second-to-last set of frame data that needed submission, Liv carefully reviewed the detailed readings of her new frame.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Compatibility is stable... The new data framework is running smoothly. M.I.N.D.'s overall performance has increased by about 5.47%, which is 0.68% higher than last time.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'There were a few minor fluctuations after the new dataset was activated. The peak was around 1.46%.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Did they identify the cause this time?', 3: '70'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Let me see... No, the report doesn't say.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'But it does note that "minor M.I.N.D. fluctuations are within expected parameters for a new frame."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "It's okay, really. I remember having the same kind of readings when I switched to the Empyrea frame...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The initial development of the Empyrea frame used rather extreme approaches, but this current frame...'}
{2: 'I hope this frame can stay with you much longer.', 3: '79', 4: 'I hope this frame can carry you into your future.', 5: '81'}
{3: "Liv's finger stilled over the terminal. She turned, and her gaze found you."}
{1: '1', 3: 'High among the clouds, you see your own form reflected in her eyes.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Then, she smiled—a ray of light in a dying galaxy, a spring breeze coaxing buds to green. With infinite tenderness, she reached out and smoothed a wrinkle from your shoulder.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Have you ever thought about the future, Commandant? I mean... the distant one.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'What does that future look like to you, Commandant?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Maybe you could think about it now? If the war really ended one day... what would you want to do?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'You had worked for years to "end the war," but when suddenly faced with the question, only one thing came to mind...'}
{2: 'Retirement!', 3: '116', 4: 'Go down to the surface and do something?', 5: '122', 6: 'I have absolutely no idea...', 7: '130'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Oh, that\'s right. Your goal has always been to "live long enough to collect a pension," hasn\'t it?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'That does sound lovely. When that time comes, maybe I could retire with you. With all that free time, we could finally travel and see all sorts of places together.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Speaking of which... is "retirement" even a thing for Constructs?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Go down to the surface and do something, huh?', 4: '1'}
{2: "That's the idea. By then, the surface will need to be rebuilt from scratch.", 3: '125'}
{2: 'We could help humanity do something.', 3: '126', 4: 'We could make a fortune!', 5: '126'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "That sounds wonderful. When the time comes, I'd like to go down to the surface with you, Commandant.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Once we've saved up enough, we could even build a house where everyone can live together...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Eh... you have no idea at all?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Well, whenever I try to think about it, it all just feels so far away...', 3: '133'}
{2: 'What about you, Liv? What do you think?', 3: '134'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'I want to stay with Gray Raven. With you, Commandant.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Liv answered almost immediately. Clearly, this was an answer she'd thought about many times before."}
{2: 'Is that all?', 3: '137', 4: 'And then?', 5: '137', 6: 'What would we do together?', 7: '137'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "What comes after... I've thought about that, too.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'For once, Liv flashed a playfully mischievous smile.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I thought that if the war ended, Babylonia wouldn't disband the Task Force. We'd just transition to reconstruction work.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'We could choose quieter missions then... like helping to cultivate plants? The war has lasted so long; it must have been so hard on the ecosystem.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Or maybe we could join the WGAA and help the archaeological team? Excavating Golden Age ruins sounds like fascinating work, too.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I've thought about this as well. Maybe we could open a bakery? I'd make the pastries, Lucia could manage the register, and Lee could prepare the drinks...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'You, Commandant, would be our official taste-tester, of course.', 4: '1'}
{2: "Just taste-testing? That's it?", 3: '151', 4: "Don't I get to help with anything else?", 5: '151', 6: 'That sounds awesome.', 7: '152'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "You've worked so hard for so long, Commandant. When that day comes, you should just rest and relax.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Maybe we could find a conservation area with a nice view... Oh, but by then, they\'ll probably be called "cities" again, won\'t they?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'We could find a city with a nice view to settle down in, and maybe keep a few little animals.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'We could go shopping together, take walks... and on rainy days, we could stay in, bake some pastries, and watch an old movie from the Golden Age...', 4: '1'}
{3: "Starlight glimmered in Liv's eyes as she meticulously envisioned every possible scenario—"}
{3: 'And in every single one, the human Commandant was standing by her side.'}
{3: 'But beneath the clouds, Liv is losing her Commandant.'}
{3: 'Returning to "home," she still greets out of habit, but the human who would always welcome her back is now...'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "You've been sleeping for so long, Commandant.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Her gaze, long accustomed to the stillness of the face on the bed, is soft as she brings a basin of fresh water. With a clean cloth, she gently wipes the human's cheeks."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Today... when I went to collect your nutritional supplements... Melinoe seemed so surprised when I mentioned your name.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'She seemed confused... about why you\'re still "alive."', 4: '1'}
{3: 'After injecting the nutrient solution into the device, Liv falls silent for a moment.'}
{3: "She raises her hand and gently caresses the human's forehead."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'My mind is getting foggy, too. How many days... has it been since your coma?', 4: '1'}
{3: "She presses her lips together, blinking as she fights back the tears, then firmly takes the human's hands in her own."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I've never been afraid of my own life fading, Commandant. But you...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'A sob catches in her throat, the words barely a whisper.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'What am I supposed to do to bring you back...', 4: '1'}
{3: "At last, her tears fall, a warm drop against the human's wrist."}
{3: 'The door creaks softly. Liv hurriedly wipes her eyes as light footsteps approach from the entrance...'}
{3: "Liv kneels down, smoothing Aisling's long hair with a tender hand."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "You didn't go out to play today? Or visit Dr. Melinoe?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: "I didn't go play. I went to find wild fruits out back.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She brings her little hand from behind her back, carefully revealing a single, bright red fruit cradled in her palm.'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'I want to eat the little lamb.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: '...Then, could you be a good helper and wash the fruits first?', 4: '2'}
{3: "On the health monitoring system beside the bed, the display shows the human's vital signs approaching zero."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aisling', 3: "I've seen machines like this at the medical station...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'When the numbers look like this, Melinoe just shakes her head and says, "There\'s nothing we can do."', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The little girl stands on her tiptoes to peer intently at the monitor, then shakes her head in a small, learned gesture.'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'Hmm... Mom, what will you do if 【kuroname】 dies?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'I have never known a world without 【kuroname】, and I will not stand by and watch 【kuroname】 fade away before my eyes.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'She would sacrifice her own life for a vision of the future, but...'}
{3: 'She would never allow the commandant to be the price paid for it.'}
{3: 'Deep into the night, the conservation area lies in perfect silence, its patrol lights now hidden behind the mountains.'}
{3: 'Liv stands beside the dining table, moving with the vacant air of a sleepwalker.'}
{3: 'The memory of the commandant coming home feels as if it happened only a moment ago. But in the blink of an eye...'}
{3: 'The neglected white curtains billow like specters in the darkness, their fabric whispering a mournful dirge with the night wind.'}
{3: "She murmurs the human's name, her gaze fixed on the empty doorway, as if waiting for a miracle, as if calling a soul to return."}
{3: 'The world does not pause for a single human. The sun rises as always. And so, Liv continues her daily routine in the conservation area.'}
{3: 'As if nothing had happened, she works, she conducts her research, and she returns home to care for Aisling and the comatose human.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Yeah. I'm here to pick up this month's nutritional solution.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: "This month's... Ah, right, the nutritional solution. Of course...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Melinoe efficiently prepares the form, but as she hands it over, her movement falters.'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: '【kuroname】 has been comatose for quite some time now...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'When I last visited, the vitals were... almost negligible. Are you certain you still wish to...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'To keep caring for a patient in this condition?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: '...I believe that is a personal matter, not a medical one, Dr. Melinoe.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'I\'m sorry, I don\'t mean to overstep. It\'s just... caring for a... "patient" like this at home for so long...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She searches for the most delicate words.'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: "For Aisling... won't it be tough for her too?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: "I know you're hurting, Liv. But for Aisling's sake, perhaps... it's time to think about moving forward.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "...That's not within your professional purview, Dr. Melinoe.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'I require the standard ration of life-support nutrients. Please provide me with the amount specified on the form. Thank you.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Melinoe shakes her head, then turns to retrieve the nutrient solution from the storage room.'}
{3: 'Carrying the heavy solution by herself, Liv offers a quiet thanks to Melinoe and leaves the medical station.'}
{3: "Melinoe watches Liv's retreating figure for a long moment, then lets out a barely audible sigh."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'Her M.I.N.D. remains in disarray. Logically, she should have forgotten everything by now...', 4: '2'}
{3: 'No one should be able to escape the illusions woven by its power.'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: "I don't know why she still remembers that human either.", 4: '2'}
{2: '???', 3: 'That is precisely why... she is worthy of being my mother.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The voice from the void whispers with an ethereal lightness.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'I have already claimed the consciousness shards of that human... of 【kuroname】.', 4: '1'}
{2: '???', 3: 'I will make her... and her M.I.N.D. truly mine.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Beyond the fog, her eyes begin to shimmer with a covetous, golden light.'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'What exactly do you want to do with her M.I.N.D.?', 4: '2'}
{2: '???', 3: "I don't know, but I want it.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'A greedy, singular desire swells within those golden pupils.'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'If... this is truly what you want.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Her fingers dance through the air, and the very fabric of the space begins to unravel, peeling away layer by layer into unreality. Behind the torn celestial curtain looms a colossal spiderweb.'}
{3: 'The web contracts, layer upon layer, its strands coalescing and thickening into a surging Red Tide.'}
{1: '31', 2: '<color=#ff4e4eff><size=55>Whatever you desire, I will give it to you, to mend that indelible regret.</size></color>', 4: '50'}
{3: 'Whatever you desire, I will give it to you, to mend that indelible regret.'}
{3: 'The Red Tide descends on schedule, a voracious, crimson shroud that smothers the mountain-nestled conservation area.'}

{3: 'Caught completely off guard, the patrol team loses half its members in an instant. Now, Conservation Area 368 stands isolated, like a solitary manor trapped in a blizzard, utterly cut off from any hope of rescue.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Conservation Area Supervisor', 3: "...We've lost contact with all surrounding conservation areas!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The supervisor paces in frantic circles across the central plaza.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Patrol Soldier', 3: "What... what do we do now?! The serum stocks are gone; we don't even have a reserve of protective suits...", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Liv stands motionless amid the swirling chaos.'}

{3: 'To her, the scene feels staged, the people around her like actors in a play, each fervently performing their prescribed roles of "desperation." It\'s as if they are all waiting, urging her to step into the spotlight and play her part...'}
{1: '1', 3: "The little girl with blue hair tugs gently at Liv's sleeve."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: '...Aisling? Sweetie, why are you out here? I asked you to stay in your room.', 4: '2'}
{3: "Liv kneels down, gently smoothing Aisling's hair, which has become disheveled from running."}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'The person in the room... 【kuroname】 woke up.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Aisling whispers the news softly to Liv.'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'I saw 【kuroname】 open eyes, so I came to tell you...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Their house is near the edge of the conservation area, not far from where the Red Tide is spreading.'}
{3: 'Two streets away, she spots the emaciated figure stumbling out the front door.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The figure seems to hesitate for a fraction of a second.'}
{3: 'But it does not stop at the sound of her desperate, shattered cries.'}
{3: 'The Red Tide suddenly rears up like a leviathan, its crest curving into an impossible, towering arc.'}
{3: "Liv lunges forward, her fingers stretching, straining—and brushing nothing but the empty air where the human's clothing had just been."}
{3: 'The figure is gone. Instantly, utterly engulfed by the crashing tide of crimson.'}
{3: 'A grief so violent it feels physical seizes her M.I.N.D. It is a blizzard, a shock of ten thousand needles, and her fingers go instantly, deathly cold.'}
{3: 'She screams, a raw, gut-wrenching sound torn from her core, but the Red Tide offers no answer. It simply recedes, its waves lapping indifferently against the shore.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'Liv, stay calm. You have to stay calm...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'And remember... remember you still have Aisling...', 4: '1'}
{3: "Melinoe's voice is strained, the simplest comfort feeling futile as she offers it."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Liv turns toward the child aside, a hollow look in her eyes...'}
{3: 'The child, oblivious to the danger of a Red Tide projection, lets out a gleeful cheer as she darts through the forest of adult legs—'}
{3: 'And sprints headlong into the Red Tide.'}
{3: 'An absolute, suffocating silence crashes down upon the conservation area. Slowly, mechanically, Liv rises to her feet.'}
{3: "Melinoe's hand shoots out, a futile gesture. With her movement, the very dust motes hang frozen, and time itself seems to stretch into a brittle, endless moment."}
{1: '1', 3: 'As everyone in the conservation area turns their heads in mechanical unison, a chaotic, staticky buzzing swells—', 4: '1', 5: '2', 6: '3'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Within the Red Tide, "Aisling" is deconstructed. Her form dissolves like clay in water, only to be remolded by the tide.'}
{3: "The Red Tide's delirious whispers coil through the air. And then, another figure begins to rise beside the child."}
{1: '1', 3: "It has no face, no defining features, yet its silhouette is a scar upon Liv's soul, a shape she knows all too well..."}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'Can we... eat... the little lamb now?', 4: '1'}
{3: "The child's voice, once innocent, now twists into something grotesque as it echoes from within the Red Tide."}
{3: 'Aisling "speaks" with confusion. Beside her, the humanoid figure instantly collapses as if foreshadowing an inevitable end.'}
{3: 'Tears well in the eyes of the child denied her mother. When she realizes Liv will not come closer, her confusion shatters into heart-wrenching wails.'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'Mom... why are you not coming? Come stay with me...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: 'I want you to hug me. Come stay with me and 【kuroname】...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Her weeping amplifies, resonating through the crimson medium as the Red Tide swells, climbing steadily higher.'}
{3: 'Liv lowers her gaze, veiling the profound sorrow within her eyes. The Red Tide laps hungrily at the soil, its leading edge nearly reaching her ankles.'}
{3: 'The Red Tide projection murmurs, its small hands reaching for Liv.'}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: "I'm here. 【kuroname】 is here. Let's be together forever...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Since the very beginning... it has always been you.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The Red Tide rustles at her feet, the crimson waves churning as if brewing a new storm.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Yet Liv does not flinch. As she has always done, she kneels, meeting the "projection" at eye level. Her expression holds no fear, only a profound, bottomless sadness.'}
{3: 'This is not the reaction it anticipated.'}
{3: "After losing her family, her child... shouldn't she be terrified? Shouldn't she be furious? Shouldn't she be shattered by grief?!"}
{3: 'Its voice falters, like a child denied a treat. The projection freezes, its wailing dying into utter bewilderment.'}
{3: "Why isn't she like the humans from Melinoe's memories? Why doesn't she rush headlong into the Red Tide, desperate to join her perished loved ones?"}
{2: 'Aisling', 3: "Don't you love me? Don't you love 【kuroname】...?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Of course, I love Commandant. And I love you, too.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Perhaps for a while, I truly let myself get lost in the warmth you created...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "You must've worked hard. Would you like to eat something first?"}
{1: '1', 2: 'Aisling', 3: 'I picked lots of wild fruits again today!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "Alright, come wash your hands. Lunch's almost ready.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Though the world is an illusion, the memories they have shared together are real enough.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'Why did I wait until now to expose your charade?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The sky shatters, piece by piece, peeling away to reveal a horrifying crimson void. Waves of Red Tide surge ever higher, now pouring down from the broken heavens.'}
{3: "Liv's gaze is steady, fixed on Aisling."}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'I need to know who created this place, and who wants...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Thundercracks, violent and final, shake the very air.'}

{3: 'The world freezes in this moment. The Red Tide projection shatters. The false sky dissolves as a monstrous, crimson wave erupts through it, sending the illusion crashing down in a rain of nothing.'}
{3: 'Liv thrusts her hand into the surging Red Tide. Instantly, the "infection" crawls like venom from her fingertips.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "All this time... I've suspected everyone. I've run through every possible ending in my mind...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I just didn't want to believe... that it was really you.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The "Red Tide" creeps greedily up her arm, a corrosive whisper trying to invade her chaotic M.I.N.D.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "This is what you wanted, isn't it?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'As the last of the false illusions is devoured by the "Red Tide", Liv\'s fingers close firmly around something solid within—'}
{3: "A cloth strip. The Gray Raven Commandant's cloth strip, the very one once tied firmly around her own wrist."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Come and see the thing you want... what it truly is.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Her Lotus Wheel slices a fierce, silver scar through the air, striking toward the heart of the Red Tide—'}
